document_title: Chronic glomerulonephritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: viem-cau-than-man.json_7_What factors increase the risk of disease?
subsection_content:
Factors that can increase the risk of chronic glomerulonephritis that you need to pay attention to include: (5)
Bacterial or viral infections anywhere can make things worse; People who regularly smoke and use alcohol; People with acute glomerulonephritis that persists or recurs many times; People who regularly use drugs that are harmful to the kidneys; People whose diet is too high in salt; People with obesity; Some geographic and racial factors such as being black or Asian American; People with abnormal kidney structure
